CommandBindingCollection Class

In this Article

Represents a collection of CommandBinding objects.

Syntax

Declaration

public sealed class CommandBindingCollection : System.Collections.IList

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • System.Object
  • CommandBindingCollection

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
,
Equals(Object,Object)
,
GetHashCode()
,
GetType()
,
MemberwiseClone()
,
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)
,
ToString()

Remarks

All objects which derive from UIElement have a CommandBindingCollection named

CommandBindings.

Constructors summary

CommandBindingCollection()

Initializes a new instance of the CommandBindingCollection class.
CommandBindingCollection(IList)

Initializes a new instance of the CommandBindingCollection class using the items in the specified IList.

Properties summary

Count

Gets the number of CommandBinding items in this CommandBindingCollection.
IsFixedSize

Gets a value indicating whether this CommandBindingCollection has a fixed size.
IsReadOnly

Gets a value indicating whether this CommandBindingCollection is read-only.
IsSynchronized

Gets a value indicating whether access to this CommandBindingCollection is synchronized (thread-safe).
Item(Int32)

Gets or sets the CommandBinding at the specified index.
SyncRoot

Gets an object that can be used to synchronize access to the CommandBindingCollection.

Methods summary

Add(CommandBinding)

Adds the specified CommandBinding to this CommandBindingCollection.
AddRange(ICollection)

Adds the items of the specified ICollection to the end of this CommandBindingCollection.
Clear()

Removes all items from this CommandBindingCollection.
Contains(CommandBinding)

Determines whether the specified CommandBinding is in this CommandBindingCollection.
CopyTo(CommandBinding[],Int32)

Copies all of the items in the CommandBindingCollection to the specified one-dimensional array, starting at the specified index of the target array.
GetEnumerator()

Gets an enumerator that iterates through this CommandBindingCollection.
IndexOf(CommandBinding)

Searches for the first occurrence of the specified CommandBinding in this CommandBindingCollection.
Insert(Int32,CommandBinding)

Inserts the specified CommandBinding into this CommandBindingCollection at the specified index.
Remove(CommandBinding)

Removes the first occurrence of the specified CommandBinding from this CommandBindingCollection.
RemoveAt(Int32)

Removes the specified CommandBinding at the specified index of this CommandBindingCollection.

For a description of this member, see stem.Collections.IList.Insert*.

For a description of this member, see stem.Collections.IList.Item*.

For a description of this member, see stem.Collections.IList.Remove*.

Constructors

  • CommandBindingCollection()

    Initializes a new instance of the CommandBindingCollection class.

    public CommandBindingCollection ();
  • CommandBindingCollection(IList)

    Initializes a new instance of the CommandBindingCollection class using the items in the specified IList.

    public CommandBindingCollection (System.Collections.IList commandBindings);

    Parameters

    • commandBindings
      IList

      The collection whose items are copied to the new CommandBindingCollection.

Properties

  • Count

    Gets the number of CommandBinding items in this CommandBindingCollection.

    public int Count { get; }

    Property Value

    • Int32

      The number of bindings in the collection.

  • IsFixedSize

    Gets a value indicating whether this CommandBindingCollection has a fixed size.

    public bool IsFixedSize { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the collection has a fixed size; otherwise, false. The default value is false.

    Remarks

    A CommandBindingCollection is never a fixed size; therefore, IsFixedSize will always return false.

  • IsReadOnly

    Gets a value indicating whether this CommandBindingCollection is read-only.

    public bool IsReadOnly { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the collection is read-only; otherwise, false. The default value is false.

    Remarks

    A CommandBindingCollection is never read-only; therefore, IsReadOnly will always return false.

  • IsSynchronized

    Gets a value indicating whether access to this CommandBindingCollection is synchronized (thread-safe).

    public bool IsSynchronized { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the collection is thread-safe; otherwise, false. The default value is false.

    Remarks

    SyncRoot can be used to synchronize access to the collection.

  • Item(Int32)

    Gets or sets the CommandBinding at the specified index.

    public System.Windows.Input.CommandBinding this[int index] { get; set; }

    Parameters

    • index
      Int32

      The position in the collection.

    Property Value

    • CommandBinding

      The binding at the specified index.

  • SyncRoot

    Gets an object that can be used to synchronize access to the CommandBindingCollection.

    public object SyncRoot { get; }

    Property Value

    • System.Object

      An object that can be used to synchronize access to the CommandBindingCollection.

Methods

  • Add(CommandBinding)

    Adds the specified CommandBinding to this CommandBindingCollection.

    public int Add (System.Windows.Input.CommandBinding commandBinding);

    Parameters

    • commandBinding
      CommandBinding

      The binding to add to the collection.

    Returns

    • Int32

      0, if the operation was successful (note that this is not the index of the added item).

    Exceptions

    • NotSupportedException

      commandBinding is null.

    Example

    The following example creates a CommandBinding and adds it to the CommandBindingCollection of a Window. 

    <Window x:Class="SDKSamples.Window1"
    xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/winfx/2006/xaml/presentation"
    xmlns:x="http://schemas.microsoft.com/winfx/2006/xaml"
    xmlns:custom="clr-namespace:SDKSamples"
    Height="600" Width="800"
    >
  <Window.CommandBindings>
    <CommandBinding Command="{x:Static custom:Window1.CustomRoutedCommand}"
                    Executed="ExecutedCustomCommand"
                    CanExecute="CanExecuteCustomCommand" />
  </Window.CommandBindings>

    CommandBinding customCommandBinding = new CommandBinding(
    CustomRoutedCommand, ExecutedCustomCommand, CanExecuteCustomCommand);

// attach CommandBinding to root window
this.CommandBindings.Add(customCommandBinding);

    Dim customCommandBinding As New CommandBinding(CustomRoutedCommand, AddressOf ExecutedCustomCommand, AddressOf CanExecuteCustomCommand)

' attach CommandBinding to root window
Me.CommandBindings.Add(customCommandBinding)
  • AddRange(ICollection)

    Adds the items of the specified ICollection to the end of this CommandBindingCollection.

    public void AddRange (System.Collections.ICollection collection);

    Parameters

    • collection
      ICollection

      The collection of items to add to the end of this CommandBindingCollection.

    Exceptions

    • NotSupportedException

      The collection to add is null.

  • Clear()

    Removes all items from this CommandBindingCollection.

    public void Clear ();

    Determines whether the specified CommandBinding is in this CommandBindingCollection.

    Parameters

    • commandBinding
      CommandBinding

      The binding to locate in the collection.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if the specified CommandBinding is in the collection; otherwise, false.

  • CopyTo(CommandBinding[],Int32)

    Copies all of the items in the CommandBindingCollection to the specified one-dimensional array, starting at the specified index of the target array.

    public void CopyTo (System.Windows.Input.CommandBinding[] commandBindings, int index);

    Parameters

    • commandBindings
      CommandBinding[]

      The array into which the collection is copied.

    • index
      Int32

      The index position in commandBindings at which copying starts.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      commandBindings is null.

    • ArgumentOutOfRangeException

      index is less than 0.

  • GetEnumerator()

    Gets an enumerator that iterates through this CommandBindingCollection.

    public System.Collections.IEnumerator GetEnumerator ();

    Returns

    • IEnumerator

      The enumerator for this collection.

  • IndexOf(CommandBinding)

    Searches for the first occurrence of the specified CommandBinding in this CommandBindingCollection.

    public int IndexOf (System.Windows.Input.CommandBinding value);

    Parameters

    • value
      CommandBinding

      The binding to locate in the collection.

    Returns

    • Int32

      The index of the first occurrence of value, if found; otherwise, -1.

  • Insert(Int32,CommandBinding)

    Inserts the specified CommandBinding into this CommandBindingCollection at the specified index.

    public void Insert (int index, System.Windows.Input.CommandBinding commandBinding);

    Parameters

    • index
      Int32

      The zero-based index at which to insert commandBinding

    • commandBinding
      CommandBinding

      The binding to insert.

    Exceptions

    • NotSupportedException

      commandBinding is null.

  • Remove(CommandBinding)

    Removes the first occurrence of the specified CommandBinding from this CommandBindingCollection.

    public void Remove (System.Windows.Input.CommandBinding commandBinding);

    Parameters

    • commandBinding
      CommandBinding

      The binding to remove.

  • RemoveAt(Int32)

    Removes the specified CommandBinding at the specified index of this CommandBindingCollection.

    public void RemoveAt (int index);

    Parameters

    • index
      Int32

      The zero-based index of the CommandBinding to remove.

Explicit Interface Implementations

  • ICollection.CopyTo(Array,Int32)

    For a description of this member, see stem.Collections.ICollection.CopyTo*.

    void ICollection.CopyTo (Array array, int index);

    Parameters

    • array
      Array

      A zero-based Array that receives the copied items from the CommandBindingCollection.

    • index
      Int32

      The first position in the specified Array to receive the copied contents.

    Remarks

    This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the CommandBindingCollection instance is cast to an ICollection interface.

    This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the CommandBindingCollection instance is cast to an IList interface.

      System.Object

      The Object to locate in the TextEffectCollection.

    Returns

      true if the Object is found in the CommandBindingCollection; otherwise, false.
